        $('#tell-me-more').click(function () {
            var clickSource = $("body").attr("class") + '-mini';
            if ($("body").hasClass("questions-page")) {
                clickSource = 'questionpagemini';
            }
            if ($("body").hasClass("home-page")) {
                clickSource = 'homepagemini';

            StackExchange.using("gps", function () {
                StackExchange.gps.track("hero.action", { hero_action_type: "close" }, true);
            });
            $.cookie("hero", "none", { path: "/" });
            var $hero = $("#herobox-mini");
            $hero.slideUp('fast', function () { $hero.remove(); });
            return false;
        });

			<!--googleon: all-->
			<div id="question-header">
			<h1 itemprop="name"><a href="/questions/1866821/is-mvc-a-design-pattern-or-architectural-pattern" class="question-hyperlink">Is MVC a Design Pattern or Architectural pattern</a></h1>
		</div>
			<div id="mainbar">

			

<div class="question" data-questionid="1866821"  id="question">
    
                <script type="text/javascript">
                var ados = ados || {};ados.run = ados.run || [];
                ados.run.push(function() { ados_add_placement(22,8277,"adzerk670612288",4).setZone(43) ; });                    
            </script>
            <div class="everyonelovesstackoverflow" id="adzerk670612288">
            </div>  


    <table>
        <tr>
            <td class="votecell">
                

<div class="vote">
    <input type="hidden" name="_id_" value="1866821">
    <a class="vote-up-off" title="This question shows research effort; it is useful and clear">up vote</a>
    <span class="vote-count-post ">31</span>
    <a class="vote-down-off" title="This question does not show any research effort; it is unclear or not useful">down vote</a>
    
    <a class="star-off" href="#" title="This is a favorite question (click again to undo)">favorite</a>
    <div class="favoritecount"><b>11</b></div>   

</div>

            </td>
            
<td class="postcell">
<div>
    <div class="post-text" itemprop="description">

        <p>According to <a href="http://java.sun.com/blueprints/patterns/MVC.html">Sun</a> and <a href="http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms978748.aspx">Msdn</a> it is a design pattern.</p>

<p>According to Wikipedia it is an architectural pattern</p>

<blockquote>
  <p>In comparison to design patterns, architectural patterns are larger in scale.
  (Wikipedia - <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Architectural%5Fpattern%5F%28computer%5Fscience%29">Architectural pattern</a>)</p>
</blockquote>

<p><strong>Or it is an architectural pattern that also has a design pattern ?</strong></p>

<p>Which one is true ?</p>

    </div>
    <div class="post-taglist">
        <a href="/questions/tagged/mvc" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged 'mvc'" rel="tag">mvc</a> <a href="/questions/tagged/design-patterns" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged 'design-patterns'" rel="tag">design-patterns</a> <a href="/questions/tagged/architectural-patterns" class="post-tag" title="show questions tagged 'architectural-patterns'" rel="tag">architectural-patterns</a> 
    </div>
    <table class="fw">
    <tr>
    <td class="vt">











<div class="post-menu"><a href="/q/1866821" title="short permalink to this question" class="short-link" id="link-post-1866821">share</a><span class="lsep">|</span><a href="/posts/1866821/edit" class="suggest-edit-post" title="">improve this question</a></div>        
    </td>
    <td class="post-signature owner">
        

    <div class="user-info ">
        <div class="user-action-time">

<a name="1866851"></a>
<div id="answer-1866851" class="answer accepted-answer" data-answerid="1866851" >
    <table>
        <tr>
            <td class="votecell">
                

<div class="vote">
    <input type="hidden" name="_id_" value="1866851">
    <a class="vote-up-off" title="This answer is useful">up vote</a>
    <span class="vote-count-post ">19</span>
    <a class="vote-down-off" title="This answer is not useful">down vote</a>
    


        <span class="vote-accepted-on load-accepted-answer-date" title="loading when this answer was accepted...">accepted</span>
</div>

            </td>
            


<td class="answercell">
    <div class="post-text"><p>MVC is more of an architectural pattern, but not for complete application. MVC mostly relates to the UI / interaction layer of an application. You're still going to need business logic layer, maybe some service layer and data access layer. That is, if you're into n-tier approach.</p>
</div>
    <table class="fw">
    <tr>
    <td class="vt">

    <td align="right" class="post-signature">

<a name="1866853"></a>
<div id="answer-1866853" class="answer" data-answerid="1866853" >
    <table>
        <tr>
            <td class="votecell">
                

<div class="vote">
    <input type="hidden" name="_id_" value="1866853">

    <a class="vote-down-off" title="This answer is not useful">down vote</a>

<td class="answercell">
    <div class="post-text"><p>Why does one of them have to be true?</p>

<p>Both can be true, depending on point of view. </p>

<p>MVC can be an architectual pattern, if it forms the basis of the application architecture.</p>

<p>It can also be seen as simply a design pattern, an abstract notion that is applicable to any application.</p>
</div>
    <table class="fw">
    <tr>
    <td class="vt">

    <td align="right" class="post-signature">

<a name="9571399"></a>
<div id="answer-9571399" class="answer" data-answerid="9571399" >
    <table>
        <tr>
            <td class="votecell">
                

<div class="vote">
    <input type="hidden" name="_id_" value="9571399">
    <a class="vote-up-off" title="This answer is useful">up vote</a>
    <span class="vote-count-post ">9</span>
    <a class="vote-down-off" title="This answer is not useful">down vote</a>
    


</div>

            </td>
            


<td class="answercell">
    <div class="post-text"><p><strong>Design patterns</strong> say how to write code effectively (considering <a href="http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb385914.aspx">Code Metrics</a>).</p>

<p>A few benefits:</p>

<ol>
<li>Easily Maintainable</li>
<li>High Re-usability</li>
<li>Readable because of abstractions</li>
</ol>

<p><strong>Architectural patterns</strong> say how to utilize resources effectively.</p>

<ol>
<li>Parallel tasks execution like programmers and graphic designers can work parallel.</li>
<li>Multiple technologies can be utilized to build a software. </li>
</ol>

<blockquote>
  <p>In MVC, 
    <strong>a).</strong> Views can be created using javascript templates and also html can be used
   <strong>b).</strong> Controllers can be written .NET framework and
   <strong>c).</strong> Models can be written in Java - a java service may be used that returns only json data.</p>
  
  <p>While in design pattern, a pattern <strong>can't</strong> be implemented in which
  code can be written in multiple technologies like AdminUser class in Java,
  Customer class in C#, Partners class in Php and a factory pattern in Ruby
  :); hmmm..so easy?:)</p>
</blockquote>
</div>
    <table class="fw">
    <tr>
    <td class="vt">











<div class="post-menu"><a href="/a/9571399" title="short permalink to this answer" class="short-link" id="link-post-9571399">share</a><span class="lsep">|</span><a href="/posts/9571399/edit" class="suggest-edit-post" title="">improve this answer</a></div>                    </td>
            


    <td align="right" class="post-signature">   
       

    

    <div class="user-info ">
        <div class="user-action-time">

<a name="2561833"></a>
<div id="answer-2561833" class="answer" data-answerid="2561833" >
    <table>
        <tr>
            <td class="votecell">
                

<div class="vote">
    <input type="hidden" name="_id_" value="2561833">
    <a class="vote-up-off" title="This answer is useful">up vote</a>
    <span class="vote-count-post ">4</span>
    <a class="vote-down-off" title="This answer is not useful">down vote</a>
    


</div>

            </td>
            


<td class="answercell">
    <div class="post-text"><p>I know that it's been answered awhile ago, but no one has yet mentioned the book that made MVC famous: Pattern-Oriented Software Architecture (POSA), by Buschmann, et al published in 1996. Though not as widely read as the Design Patterns book, by Gamma, et al, POSA is one of the foundational books used by the patterns community.</p>

<p>Oh, and POSA very clearly identifies MVC as an architectural pattern. My hunch is that MS and Sun are just being sloppy and calling every pattern a "design pattern".</p>
</div>
    <table class="fw">
    <tr>
    <td class="vt">











<div class="post-menu"><a href="/a/2561833" title="short permalink to this answer" class="short-link" id="link-post-2561833">share</a><span class="lsep">|</span><a href="/posts/2561833/edit" class="suggest-edit-post" title="">improve this answer</a></div>                    </td>
            


    <td align="right" class="post-signature">   
       

    

    <div class="user-info ">
        <div class="user-action-time">
            

                        answered <span title="2010-04-01 16:10:18Z" class="relativetime">Apr 1 '10 at 16:10</span>
        </div>
        <div class="user-gravatar32">
            <a href="/users/68631/john"><div class=""><img src="https://www.gravatar.com/avatar/599c7216bb0757b1445c269324118079?s=32&d=identicon&r=PG" alt="" width="32" height="32"></div></a>
        </div>
        <div class="user-details">
            <a href="/users/68631/john">John</a><br>
            <span class="reputation-score" title="reputation score" dir="ltr">1,184</span><span title="11 silver badges"><span class="badge2"></span><span class="badgecount">11</span></span><span title="25 bronze badges"><span class="badge3"></span><span class="badgecount">25</span></span>
        </div>
    </div>

    </td>
    </tr>
    </table>
</td>
        </tr>



<tr>
<td class="votecell"></td>

    <div id="comments-2561833" class="comments dno">

<a name="8287018"></a>
<div id="answer-8287018" class="answer" data-answerid="8287018" >
    <table>
        <tr>
            <td class="votecell">
                

<div class="vote">
    <input type="hidden" name="_id_" value="8287018">
    <a class="vote-up-off" title="This answer is useful">up vote</a>
    <span class="vote-count-post ">2</span>
    <a class="vote-down-off" title="This answer is not useful">down vote</a>
    


</div>

            </td>
            


<td class="answercell">
    <div class="post-text"><p>If you put ten software architects into a room and have them discuss what the Model-View-Controller pattern is, you will end up with twelve different opinions. â€¦ Some of the purists out there will inevitably have qualms with what I refer to as â€œMVCâ€?. Feel free to leave a flaming comment on the message board at the bottom of this Web page. I will gladly entertain different perspectives on what MVC means, but keep in mind that I do not care.</p>

<p>Josh Smith</p>
</div>
    <table class="fw">
    <tr>
    <td class="vt">











<div class="post-menu"><a href="/a/8287018" title="short permalink to this answer" class="short-link" id="link-post-8287018">share</a><span class="lsep">|</span><a href="/posts/8287018/edit" class="suggest-edit-post" title="">improve this answer</a></div>                    </td>
            


    <td align="right" class="post-signature">   
       

    

    <div class="user-info ">
        <div class="user-action-time">
            

                        answered <span title="2011-11-27 16:25:00Z" class="relativetime">Nov 27 '11 at 16:25</span>
        </div>
        <div class="user-gravatar32">
            <a href="/users/1024616/saleh-rahimzadeh"><div class=""><img src="https://www.gravatar.com/avatar/6b8e82ff5adc64502374b11187ec2c31?s=32&d=identicon&r=PG" alt="" width="32" height="32"></div></a>
        </div>
        <div class="user-details">
            <a href="/users/1024616/saleh-rahimzadeh">Saleh Rahimzadeh</a><br>
            <span class="reputation-score" title="reputation score" dir="ltr">136</span><span title="1 silver badge"><span class="badge2"></span><span class="badgecount">1</span></span><span title="5 bronze badges"><span class="badge3"></span><span class="badgecount">5</span></span>
        </div>

<a name="1866872"></a>
<div id="answer-1866872" class="answer" data-answerid="1866872" >
    <table>
        <tr>
            <td class="votecell">
                

<div class="vote">
    <input type="hidden" name="_id_" value="1866872">
    <a class="vote-up-off" title="This answer is useful">up vote</a>
    <span class="vote-count-post ">1</span>
    <a class="vote-down-off" title="This answer is not useful">down vote</a>
    


</div>

            </td>
            


<td class="answercell">
    <div class="post-text"><p>And according to Martin Fowler they are GUI architectures: <a href="http://www.martinfowler.com/eaaDev/uiArchs.html" rel="nofollow">Martin Fowler-GUI architectures</a></p>

<p>It depends on the size of the application, as it only affects GUI related classes, in a small one (mostly GUI) it could be considered an architectural pattern whereas in a huge one it would just be a design pattern that you apply to the GUI code (could be 10% of the apps code).</p>
</div>
    <table class="fw">
    <tr>
    <td class="vt">











<div class="post-menu"><a href="/a/1866872" title="short permalink to this answer" class="short-link" id="link-post-1866872">share</a><span class="lsep">|</span><a href="/posts/1866872/edit" class="suggest-edit-post" title="">improve this answer</a></div>                    </td>
            


    <td align="right" class="post-signature">   
       

    

    <div class="user-info ">
        <div class="user-action-time">
            

                        answered <span title="2009-12-08 13:09:25Z" class="relativetime">Dec 8 '09 at 13:09</span>
        </div>
        <div class="user-gravatar32">
            <a href="/users/2697/iker-jimenez"><div class=""><img src="https://www.gravatar.com/avatar/17404e0c1869fec55dd69f7c033de12e?s=32&d=identicon&r=PG" alt="" width="32" height="32"></div></a>
        </div>
        <div class="user-details">
            <a href="/users/2697/iker-jimenez">Iker Jimenez</a><br>
            <span class="reputation-score" title="reputation score" dir="ltr">2,953</span><span title="2 gold badges"><span class="badge1"></span><span class="badgecount">2</span></span><span title="21 silver badges"><span class="badge2"></span><span class="badgecount">21</span></span><span title="36 bronze badges"><span class="badge3"></span><span class="badgecount">36</span></span>

<a name="1866845"></a>
<div id="answer-1866845" class="answer" data-answerid="1866845" >
    <table>
        <tr>
            <td class="votecell">
                

<div class="vote">
    <input type="hidden" name="_id_" value="1866845">
    <a class="vote-up-off" title="This answer is useful">up vote</a>
    <span class="vote-count-post ">1</span>
    <a class="vote-down-off" title="This answer is not useful">down vote</a>
    


</div>

            </td>
            


<td class="answercell">
    <div class="post-text"><p>I think both are true.  If you're looking at a particular <em>instantiation</em> of MVC in a framework like Ruby on Rails, that instantiation is more of a design pattern.  If you look at MVC as a <em>general concept</em>, it's more of an architectural pattern.</p>
</div>
    <table class="fw">
    <tr>
    <td class="vt">











<div class="post-menu"><a href="/a/1866845" title="short permalink to this answer" class="short-link" id="link-post-1866845">share</a><span class="lsep">|</span><a href="/posts/1866845/edit" class="suggest-edit-post" title="">improve this answer</a></div>                    </td>
    <td align="right" class="post-signature">

<a name="5682675"></a>
<div id="answer-5682675" class="answer" data-answerid="5682675" >
    <table>
        <tr>
            <td class="votecell">
                

<div class="vote">
    <input type="hidden" name="_id_" value="5682675">
    <a class="vote-up-off" title="This answer is useful">up vote</a>
    <span class="vote-count-post ">1</span>

</div>

            </td>
            


<td class="answercell">
    <div class="post-text"><p>MVC is architecture pattern. Very clearly stated and shown at <a href="http://molecularsciences.org/zend/mvc_model_view_controller" rel="nofollow">http://molecularsciences.org/zend/mvc_model_view_controller</a></p>
</div>
    <table class="fw">
    <tr>
    <td class="vt">

    <td align="right" class="post-signature">   
       

    

    <div class="user-info ">

<a name="8246467"></a>
<div id="answer-8246467" class="answer" data-answerid="8246467" >
    <table>
        <tr>
            <td class="votecell">
                

<div class="vote">
    <input type="hidden" name="_id_" value="8246467">
    <a class="vote-up-off" title="This answer is useful">up vote</a>
    <span class="vote-count-post ">1</span>
    <a class="vote-down-off" title="This answer is not useful">down vote</a>
    


</div>

            </td>
            


<td class="answercell">
    <div class="post-text"><p>MVC always mentioned and introduced as/in presentation layer in software architecture books.</p>

<p>Read these books:</p>

<ol>
<li><p><a href="http://rads.stackoverflow.com/amzn/click/073562609X" rel="nofollow">Architecting Microsoft.NET Solutions for the Enterprise</a> (Microsoft press)</p></li>
<li><p><a href="http://rads.stackoverflow.com/amzn/click/0470292784" rel="nofollow">Professional ASP.NET design patterns</a> (Wrox)</p></li>
<li><p><a href="http://rads.stackoverflow.com/amzn/click/0735618399" rel="nofollow">Enterpise Solutions Patterns Using Microsoft.NET</a> (Microsoft press)</p></li>
<li><p><a href="http://rads.stackoverflow.com/amzn/click/0321127420" rel="nofollow">Patterns of Enterprise Application Architecture</a> (Addison Wesley)</p></li>
<li><p><a href="http://rads.stackoverflow.com/amzn/click/0131412752" rel="nofollow">A Practical Guide to Enterprise Architecture</a> (Prentice Hall)</p></li>
</ol>
</div>
    <table class="fw">
    <tr>
    <td class="vt">

    <td align="right" class="post-signature">

        <h2><strong>protected</strong> by <a href="/users/597607/bo-persson">Bo Persson</a> <span title="2011-11-27 17:49:03Z" class="relativetime">Nov 27 '11 at 17:49</span></h2>
        <p>This question is protected to prevent "thanks!", "me too!", or spam answers by new users. 
To answer it, you must have earned at least 10 <a href="/help/whats-reputation">reputation</a> on this site.</p>
    </div>

					<h4 id="h-related">Related</h4>
					<div class="related" data-tracker="rq=1">
